headline.main: Serb Turnout in Kosovo Vote Seen as an Encouraging Step

lead_paragraph: Kosovo's Serbs turned out in much greater numbers than originally thought in elections on Saturday, showing that they see a future despite the Albanian domination of their province and securing a real level of power in a new provincial assembly, Western officials said today. Most Serbs appear to have voted just before polls closed, and after dark so they would not be seen by community leaders opposed to taking part in the vote for a 120-seat assembly. The elections were devised by the international officials who have ruled Kosovo since the war over it ended in June 1999 and NATO troops arrived here.
